intro: Parietaria oppositifolia, commonly known as the common wall-rocket, is a flowering plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It is a low-growing annual or biennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features alternate, heart-shaped leaves with a rough, hairy texture, and it produces small, yellowish-green flowers in clusters. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found along roadsides, in waste areas, and on walls. Parietaria oppositifolia is also known for its allergenic properties, as it can cause skin irritation and respiratory issues in some individuals.
